text: Each year in the United States, about 240,000 cases of breast cancer are diagnosed in women and about 2,100 in men. This Breast Cancer Awareness month, I salute those who have combatted this illness, as well as our healthcare professionals who work tirelessly to treat it.

Happy #WorldTeachersDay to the incredible educators in #GA04 and beyond! Your dedication to shaping the future is appreciated not just here, but around the world. Thank you for your tireless efforts in shaping the future of our youth.

I know of no man in his post presidency who has had a greater impact on humanity than President Carter. His selfless service to mankind is unparalleled, as is his humbleness and fortitude. 
Happy 99th birthday, Jimmy Carter!

My condolences are with Senator Feinstein's loved ones and staff on this difficult day. Thrust into higher office by tragedy, may we remember her legacy as a trailblazer for gun violence prevention, women, LGBTQ+ rights, and more. Her impact will be felt for years to come.
We need court reform now. #SupremeCorruption
Members of Congress have term limits- they are called elections. My TERM Act would enforce term limits for Supreme Court Justices. They are unelected & unaccountable to the people.

Honored to join my friend @SenWhitehouse & former Attorney General @EricHolder to discuss the necessity & urgency of court reform. Our SCERT Act is critical legislation & I am proud to be the lead sponsor in the House.

Justice Clarence Thomas’ personal relationship w/ the Kochs is a blatant conflict of interest, ethically unacceptable – he MUST recuse. Congress must pass my & @SenWhitehouse #SCERTAct to ensure justices are serving everyday American interest & not their billionaire friends.

I want to extend a meaningful #YomKippur and easy fast to our Jewish constituents in #GA04 and beyond. May this Day of Atonement bring peace, reflection, and spiritual growth to you and your families.

2/3 of Americans support term limits for SCOTUS. 

Lifetime appointment has led to a court that is insulated from & unaccountable to the American people.  

My TERM Act would establish 18 year term limits for justices & regularize appointments. #CourtReformNow

I am proud to re-introduce my TERM Act alongside my colleagues who have joined our efforts to reform the court. 

We know what MAGA really means, and we know that this legislation is crucial in curtailing these anti-democratic measures led by the Federalist Society.

Today, I’m using my voice to advocate for those who      have been silenced for far too long. The #BrittanyClardyAct aims to create a safer world for Black women and girls. I’m proud to co-sponsor this      crucial legislation led by @Ilhan and @RepBonnie.
The time for court reform is now. Thank you, @RepAdamSchiff, for supporting the TERM Act and fighting to restore balance & legitimacy to the Supreme Court.

As a proud member of the @Labor_Caucus, I stand with @UAW in their fight to secure the contracts they deserve.
Today, we recognize what brings us together as Americans. As the congressman for #GA04, I will continue to defend rights for all Americans and work to form a more perfect union. #ConstitutionDay

Wishing a sweet and happy new year to all who observe #RoshHashanah in #GA04, throughout the United States, & across the world. May it bring love, peace, and happiness to all.

#HispanicHeritageMonth reminds us that our culture, economy & nation are made stronger by diversity.

This month, we recognize Hispanic heritage. This is a special time to celebrate & recognize the countless contributions the Latino community has made to make America better.

According to The Defense POW/MIA Accounting Agency, more than 81,000 Americans remain missing from WWII, the Korean War, the Vietnam War, the Cold War, and the Gulf Wars. This POW/MIA Recognition Day, I salute our veterans who never returned home.

Today marks 60 years since Addie Mae Collins, Cynthia Wesley, Carole Robertson & Denise McNair were killed in the 16th St. Baptist Church bombing in Birmingham. Let us honor their memory by fighting hate, bigotry & violence.

29 years ago, the first ever federal Assault Weapons Ban was signed into law. Countless lives were saved because of it. Congress must reinstate a ban on the manufacturing, sale, & transfer of military-style weapons. Everyone should have the right to go out in public without fear.

Safety has long been my priority. I'm pleased that my Safe Roads Act, which mandates automatic emergency braking systems for large trucks - was part of the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law. As autonomous vehicles emerge, we must double down on safety measures to protect our drivers.

Without the expanded #ChildTaxCredit, child poverty has dramatically skyrocketed. 
 
Republicans refusal to work with us, let it expire. It's time to put America's kids first and permanently extend this lifeline.

22 years ago, the world forever changed after the attacks of 9/11. My sincere gratitude goes to our 1st responders, those on the scene at Ground Zero & those who serve in our communities every day. May we never forget this terrible day in our nation's history & honor the fallen.

Truck drivers power our economy, keep store shelves stocked, and deliver relief supplies. Their extraordinary dedication should be recognized.

If you see a trucker this National Truck Driver Appreciation Week, please take the time to say “thank you.” #NTDAW23 #ThankATrucker

September is Suicide Prevention Awareness Month, a reminder of the ongoing need in our country to expand resources and address this crisis.

If you or a loved one is in crisis, call or text 988 to reach the Suicide & Crisis Lifeline for free, confidential help 24/7.

I celebrated the groundbreaking of a new regional transportation center at @GoGPTC. The investments & efforts bringing this project to fruition are a testament to what we can do when we put #PeopleOverPolitics and get to work for our constituents.

.@meredadjohnson and I are deeply saddened by the tragic accident that caused the death of 5 teenagers, 3 of whom attended @LakesideViking1. We encourage all students to meet with staff and family to express their feelings and receive the support they need.

On #LaborDay, I'm honoring American workers & celebrating the hard-won accomplishments of the labor movement – like the 8-hour workday & the 5-day workweek.
As we fight to raise wages & protect the right to organize, I'm committed to ensuring that every worker’s voice is heard.

We must speak up and speak out and continue getting in good trouble to push back against hate in all its forms. Please wake up and pay attention!

The Breman Museum illustrates how subtle acts of antisemitism and discrimination can metastasize, and we must stop it in its tracks. We’ve seen this cycle and these tropes before and what can happen if left unchecked and unchallenged.

In #GA04, we have seen anti-Semitic fliers thrown in the driveways of my constituents. Around the nation, people are being targeted and killed because of their race – like in Buffalo and Jacksonville. We must not tolerate this.

🧵I took the opportunity to visit the @BremanMuseum in Atlanta last week to better understand the past but to also wrap my head about what’s happening today. I’m very concerned about the rise of racism, race-based violence, and antisemitism.

I was eight years old and living in Washington D.C. when the March on Washington took place. 60 years later, I was honored to stand with my @TheBlackCaucus colleagues at #MOW60 as we continue the work of the civil rights heroes whose shoulders we stand upon.

The #InflationReductionAct made historic investments in clean, secure, and affordable energy. That’s lowering costs for families, tackling the climate crisis, and supporting 1,000 clean energy jobs in #GA04.

With the #InflationReductionAct, Democrats took on special interests to lower insulin costs in #GA04. Our new $35 a month cap on insulin costs is saving 3,200 Medicare beneficiaries living in #GA04, who use insulin an average of $450 annually compared to 2020 prices.

The #InflationReductionAct helps make health care coverage more affordable for the estimated 74k people signed up for a marketplace plan in #GA04. The average enrollee will save $630 in premiums this year. Now, four in five Americans can find a plan for less than $10 a month.
🧵Thread on why the #InflationReductionAct is a win for Georgia and is lowering costs and creating jobs.

The #InflationReductionAct invests:

🤝$3B to reconnect communities divided by highways
🧱$2B for low carbon construction materials
🏬$250M to make federal buildings green
✈️$244.5M for sustainable aviation fuel projects

The law has supported families and boosted the economy.

Travelers who want to visit D.C. face the most expensive domestic ticket prices compared to other major markets because of limited competition. The #DCAAct will help alleviate that pressure on consumers & the flying public & would increase slots across all carriers equally.

DCA remains the only airport in the country that is still bound by this outdated federal
regulation that caps the number of flights farther than 1,250 miles. By limiting flights, we are squeezing consumers –it’s our constituents who are paying the price.

With few exceptions, the perimeter rule limits the distance that incoming & outgoing flights can travel at DCA to no more than 1,250 miles. This rule is making travel to the D.C. region more expensive & less convenient for consumers, businesses, & communities.

Congress restricted air traffic at DCA in the 1960s — in part to encourage airlines to grow their long-distance flight options from the then-newly built Washington Dulles airport that had just been built in then-rural Virginia — by creating perimeter rule limits.
Today, I introduced the Direct Capital Access Act alongside my colleague, @RepBurgessOwens. This bill seeks to add 14 in- and beyond-perimeter flights at DCA in the 2023 FAA Reauthorization bill.
